questions.text: Which of the following is an active electronic component?
The Maximum Power Transfer theorem states that maximum power is delivered from a source to a load when the load resistance is:
The power factor of an AC circuit is defined as the ratio of:
The process of adding impurities to a pure semiconductor to alter its conductivity is called:
The Barkhausen criterion for sustained oscillation in an amplifier with feedback states that the loop gain must be:
Crossover distortion in a Class B amplifier is caused by:

choices.text: The transistors not turning on at 0.7V for silicon
The input signal frequency being too high

questions.text: The Binary Coded Decimal (BCD) representation of the decimal number 49 is:
An XOR gate produces a HIGH output only when:

choices.text: The number of HIGH inputs is odd
The number of HIGH inputs is even

questions.text: A digital circuit that counts from 0 to a predetermined number is called a:
The accumulator is a register in a microprocessor that:

choices.text: Stores the address of the next instruction
Holds the result of arithmetic and logic operations
Keeps track of the stack pointer

questions.text: In serial data transmission, synchronous transmission:

choices.text: Sends one bit at a time with start and stop bits
Uses a common clock signal for both sender and receiver
Does not require a clock signal

questions.text: An Interrupt Service Routine (ISR) is a:

choices.text: A special function or routine that is executed when a specific interrupt occurs
A register that stores the interrupt type

questions.text: In C, what is the purpose of the goto statement?

choices.text: To provide an unconditional jump to a labeled statement within the same function

questions.text: Which C standard library function is used to move the file pointer to a specific location in a file?
The this pointer in C++ is a special pointer that:

choices.text: Points to the next object in an array
Points to the current object instance for which a member function is called
Points to the base class of an object

questions.text: A class that cannot be instantiated and is meant to be inherited from is called an:
A microinstruction is:

choices.text: A low-level instruction that controls the functional units of a processor in a microprogrammed control unit
A very small instruction in a RISC architecture
An instruction that performs a memory operation
A synonym for an assembly language mnemonic

questions.text: The principle of locality of reference states that:

choices.text: A program accesses all parts of its memory randomly
A program tends to reuse data and instructions that it has used recently
Memory access is always faster than disk access
The CPU can only access local memory

questions.text: Programmed I/O involves:

choices.text: The CPU continuously checking the status of an I/O device
The I/O device directly accessing main memory
The I/O device signaling the CPU with an interrupt
The use of a dedicated I/O processor

questions.text: VHDL is a type of:
The Presentation Layer (Layer 6) of the OSI model is responsible for:
The main purpose of subnetting is to:

choices.text: Increase the number of available IP addresses
Divide a large network into smaller, more manageable subnetworks

questions.text: Which of the following is a characteristic of UDP?

choices.text: It provides low overhead and fast transmission

questions.text: A Virtual Private Network (VPN) is used to:

choices.text: Create a secure, encrypted connection over a less secure network like the internet
Increase the bandwidth of a network connection

questions.text: A Mealy machine is a type of finite automaton where the output depends on:

choices.text: The current state and the current input

questions.text: A parse tree is a graphical representation of:

choices.text: The flow of control in a program
The derivation of a string in a grammar
The states and transitions of a finite automaton

questions.text: Perspective projection in computer graphics creates realism by:

choices.text: Making objects that are farther away appear smaller

questions.text: Vector graphics are composed of:

choices.text: Geometric primitives such as points, lines, and curves

questions.text: The Last-In, First-Out (LIFO) principle is used in which data structure?
An algorithm that always makes the choice that seems best at the moment is known as a:
Which of the following is a Data Manipulation Language (DML) command in SQL?
The fork() system call in Unix-like operating systems is used to:
The primary advantage of the Prototyping model in software development is that it:

choices.text: Allows for early user feedback and clarification of requirements

questions.text: Alpha testing is a type of acceptance testing performed by:

choices.text: The end-users at their own site
The development team's internal testing staff at the developer's site

questions.text: In a UML class diagram, an 'association' represents:

choices.text: A general relationship between two classes
The flow of messages between objects

questions.text: The PEAS description of an AI agent's environment stands for:
Propositional logic deals with:

choices.text: Statements that can be either true or false
The flow of control in a program

questions.text: The 'crossover' operation in a genetic algorithm is a process of:

choices.text: Randomly changing a part of a solution
Combining parts of two parent solutions to create new offspring
Selecting the best solutions for the next generation
Evaluating the fitness of a solution

questions.text: PERT (Program Evaluation and Review Technique) is different from CPM (Critical Path Method) in that PERT:

choices.text: Is deterministic and uses a single time estimate for each activity
Is probabilistic and uses three time estimates (optimistic, pessimistic, most likely) for each activity
Is used only for construction projects
Does not identify a critical path

questions.text: ‘Whistleblowing’ in professional ethics is the act of:

choices.text: Praising an employer for their good practices
Reporting unethical or illegal activities within an organization to the public or a higher authority

questions.text: The Nepal Engineering Council's Code of Conduct primarily aims to:

choices.text: Ensure the professional and ethical practice of engineering in Nepal
Set the curriculum for engineering colleges

questions.text: In C++, what does the const keyword do when applied to a member function?

choices.text: It prevents the function from being called.
It indicates that the function will not modify the state of the object.
It makes the function's return value a constant.
It makes the function a static member.

questions.text: RAID (Redundant Array of Independent Disks) Level 1 provides:

choices.text: Block-level striping with a dedicated parity disk

questions.text: Which HTTP method is idempotent, meaning multiple identical requests have the same effect as a single request?
A binary heap is a binary tree that satisfies the heap property, which means:

choices.text: The left child is always smaller than the right child.
The key of each node is greater than or equal to (in a max-heap) the keys of its children.
The tree is always perfectly balanced.
All leaf nodes are at the same depth.

questions.text: The 'Durability' property in ACID transactions ensures that:

choices.text: All operations of a transaction are completed successfully or none are.
The database remains in a consistent state before and after the transaction.
Transactions are isolated from each other.
Once a transaction has been committed, it will remain so, even in the event of a power loss.

questions.text: The Capability Maturity Model Integration (CMMI) is a framework for:
A 'Naive Bayes' classifier is a machine learning model based on:

choices.text: Bayes' theorem with a strong assumption of feature independence

questions.text: In engineering economics, a 'sunk cost' is a cost that:

choices.text: Has already been incurred and cannot be recovered
Will be incurred in the future
Varies with the level of production
Is associated with the end-of-life of a project

questions.text: The primary difference between a RISC and a CISC architecture is:

choices.text: The complexity and number of instructions
The size of the cache memory

questions.text: A state in a DFA is a 'trap state' or 'sink state' if:

choices.text: Once entered, it is impossible to leave.

questions.text: What is the main purpose of the B-Tree data structure in database systems?

choices.text: To efficiently store and retrieve data from secondary storage (disks).

questions.text: Regression testing is the process of:

choices.text: Testing a particular module in isolation.
Testing the system as a whole.
Retesting a previously tested program following modification to ensure that new problems have not been introduced.

questions.text: In natural language processing (NLP), 'tokenization' is the process of:

choices.text: Determining the grammatical structure of a sentence.
Breaking a stream of text into words, phrases, or other meaningful elements called tokens.
Identifying the emotional tone of a text.
Translating text from one language to another.

questions.text: The role of a project stakeholder is to:

choices.text: Manage the project team on a daily basis.
Have an interest or stake in the project and its outcome.
Provide the technical expertise for the project.

questions.text: A Moore machine is a finite automaton where the output is determined by:

choices.text: The current state and current input

questions.text: A deadlock in an operating system can be prevented by violating one of the four necessary conditions. Which of the following is NOT one of those conditions?
In object-oriented design, 'composition' represents a:

choices.text: 'has-a' or 'part-of' relationship where the contained object's lifecycle is managed by the container
general association between two independent objects

questions.text: Which of the following is a key advantage of IPv6 over IPv4?
A 'cookie' in the context of web browsing is:

choices.text: A small piece of data sent from a website and stored on the user's computer by the web browser
A script that runs on a web page

questions.text: An RLC series circuit has a resistance of 30 Ω, an inductive reactance of 60 Ω, and a capacitive reactance of 20 Ω. What is the total impedance of the circuit?
Implement a Full Adder using two Half Adders and an OR gate. The inputs are A, B, and Cin. The outputs are Sum and Cout. The expression for Cout is:
A processor has a 2-stage pipeline (Fetch, Execute). Each stage takes one clock cycle. What is the number of clock cycles needed to execute 10 instructions?

A message of 1000 bytes is to be sent over a network. The protocol adds a 20-byte header to the message. If the network bandwidth is 5100 bytes per second, how long does it take to transmit the entire packet?
A point P(5, 8) is first translated by a vector T(–2, –3) and then reflected about the x-axis. What are the final coordinates of the point?
What is the result of inserting the following keys into an initially empty Binary Search Tree (BST) in this order: 50, 30, 70, 20, 40, 60, 80?

choices.text: The tree is skewed to the right.
The tree is skewed to the left.
The tree is a complete binary tree.
The tree is balanced with 50 as the root.

questions.text:
For the processes below, what is the average waiting time using the Round Robin scheduling algorithm with a time quantum of 4 ms? All processes arrive at time 0.
Process | Burst Time
P1 | 10
P2 | 5
P3 | 8
A project has a 60% chance of a Rs. 200,000 profit and a 40% chance of a Rs. 100,000 loss. What is the Expected Monetary Value (EMV) of the project?

What would the following SQL query return from a table named Students with columns Name and Marks?
SELECT Name FROM Students WHERE Marks = (SELECT MAX(Marks) FROM Students);

choices.text: The name of the student with the highest marks.
All student names, sorted by marks.
The highest mark in the table.

questions.text: What is the cyclomatic complexity of a program with a single loop and an if-then-else statement inside the loop?
How many hosts can be on a network with the CIDR prefix /26?
In the RSA algorithm, if p=3, q=11, and the public key e=7, what is the private key d?
What is the postfix (Reverse Polish Notation) expression for the infix expression A * (B + C) / D?

Consider a state-space graph where the heuristic value h(n) for a node n is the estimated cost to the goal. In an A* search, the evaluation function f(n) is defined as f(n) = g(n) + h(n), where g(n) is the:

choices.text: Cost from the start node to node n.
Cost from node n to the goal node.
Number of steps from the start node to n.
Heuristic value of the parent of n.

questions.text: A system has 4 page frames. For the reference string 1, 2, 3, 4, 2, 1, 5, 6, 2, 1, 2, 3, 7, 6, how many page faults occur with the FIFO page replacement algorithm?
Which design pattern is used to provide a unified interface to a set of interfaces in a subsystem, making it easier to use?
A 4:1 Multiplexer has:
Which of the following is an example of a non-functional requirement?

choices.text: The system shall allow users to register an account.
The system shall process transactions in under 2 seconds.
The system shall generate a monthly sales report.
The system shall allow administrators to delete user accounts.
